benchmark_details.name: CORECODE (Commonsense Reasoning and Conflict Detection in dialogues)
benchmark_details.overview: CORECODE is a dataset that contains abundant commonsense knowledge manually annotated on dyadic dialogues, aimed to evaluate the commonsense reasoning and commonsense conflict detection capabilities of Chinese LLMs through a series of benchmark tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the capability of LLMs in learning and applying commonsense knowledge through a well-annotated dialogue dataset.

data.source: Annotated from NaturalConv and DuLeMon datasets, encompassing multi-turn dialogues.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by crowdsourced workers following a standardized procedure.

methodology.calculation: Scoring based on model predictions against annotated ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher performance indicates better commonsense reasoning capabilities of LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Models like ChatGLM2-6B, BLOOMZ-7.1B performed best in evaluated tasks.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted to assess model performance pre- and post-fine-tuning on CORECODE.
